articles.description: Follow live text, in-play video clips and radio commentary as India play Afghanistan in the Men's Cricket World Cup 2023.
articles.title: World Cup: Afghanistan bat first against hosts India

articles.description: Latest football news, previews, analysis and transfer rumours with Wales, Scotland and England among those preparing for matches.
articles.title: Football news, transfer rumours and analysis

articles.description: Ireland wing Mack Hansen wins his race to be fit for Saturday's World Cup quarter-final against New Zealand.
articles.title: Ireland wing Hansen fit to start quarter-final

articles.description: Birmingham City appoint former England captain Wayne Rooney as their new manager on a three-and-a-half-year deal.
articles.title: Birmingham City appoint Rooney as manager

articles.description: England defender Harry Maguire says former captain David Beckham has urged him to focus on career positives after fan criticism.
articles.title: Maguire praises 'classy' Beckham for career advice

articles.description: Olympic gold medallist Mary Lou Retton is "fighting for her life" in intensive care with a "rare form of pneumonia", her daughter says.
articles.title: Former Olympic champion Retton 'fighting for life'

articles.description: Arsenal forward Beth Mead reveals her phone secrets before Sunday's WSL game with Aston Villa, including why Katie McCabe cannot be trusted.
articles.title: 'Katie McCabe is not to be trusted' - Mead's phone secrets

articles.description: South Africa legend Allan Donald reveals his years of hurt and torment after his role in the "epic movie" which was the 1999 World Cup semi-final.
articles.title: Therapy, Beckham & a crying child - Donald's 1999 torment

articles.description: Marathon world records are tumbling in the men's and women's races, though the main topic of conversation is not the athletes, but the role played by 'super-shoes'.
articles.title: 'Super-shoes' and the race for a sub two-hour marathon

articles.description: The men, one of whom crossed the line first, used the bibs of other entrants, including a woman.
articles.title: Kielder Half Marathon: Two front-runners disqualified
